data.title: Quaint Second Floor Restaurant with Great Sandwiches
data.text: I do not like sandwiches.  That said, my party of three loved these ones. They are creative, generous and delicious. The only drawback was the flight of stairs for my 91 year old mother.  BTW, they also do a dinner theater from time to time which is reportedly good.

data.title: Real authentic Cooking, very savory
data.text: My wife and i had a great lunch, she had a wonderful fresh salad, i chose the Italian sandwich. we also have had their soups over the years. really quaint place for a good lunch.

owner_response.author: betty b, Owner at The Vineyard Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We're happy to hear you and your wife enjoyed yourselves.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: Excellent food & service. Restaurant is located above a very interesting boutique on the second floor of an old residence.  Lovely trees overhang the windows and the view of Marietta Square is very nice.

owner_response.author: betty b, Owner at The Vineyard Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks Gwen! We hope to see you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dinner and a show
data.text: Not many places where you can get dinner and a show anymore so was excited about this one!  Vineyard Cafe did not disappoint.  They had a delicious buffet and the show, Steel Magnolias, was fantastic.  It is a small venue but the actors made the best use of the space they had and really entertained.  Am looking forward to going again.

data.title: Homemade food
data.text: This was a quaint little cafe. Reasonable prices on everything. Sandwiches, soup, and even a Full Tea setting. Absolutely enjoyed this!

data.title: Friendly service, good food
data.text: It takes guts to open a restaurant on a 2nd floor walk up above two retail stores.  Fortunately, Vineyard Cafe is worth the stairs.  Good food, reasonable prices, and friendly, though a bit slow, service.

data.title: Gathering with 10 friends
data.text:
I don't like to write a bad review, but I have to because it was awful. The bread and croissants were hard and stale, although our server was very nice, warm, sweet and polite he never cleaned all of our used dishes or soup cups! Had to asked to take dishes away. 
It was way overpriced for what we got! Again our bread was gross, stale & hard.Our sandwiches were lunch meat! 
I will not be going back to eat here.

data.title: A nice place to sit and enjoy your meal and talk to your friends
data.text: I eat here regularly with my friends. You can have a beautiful view of the Marietta Square.   It is one of the few spots you can really enjoy sitting and being able to talk. The food is good but as a tea room it is just OK.  They charged extra if you need more tea which is a NO NO at a tea room when you have ordered the full tea. The soup is always good but it is a very small serving in a tea cup. The chicken salad is very good either as a sandwich or with the full tea. The desserts with the tea need improvement.  The regular desserts are very good.  One interesting and different side is their sweet potato salad. The scones and cream are very good also.

data.title: AWEFUL
data.text: I have nothing good to say about my experience at the vineyard cafe. Our server was probably the worst I have ever had at any restaurant ever. She took our orders while holding a broom and dust pan. She never refilled our drinks, she yelled out the total of our bill across the restaurant when she brought back the ticket because my mother used a coupon. My poor mother was so embarrassed...she was taking us out to what she thought was going to be a very nice tea and luncheon. The food was mediocre at best and the coconut bonbons were so nasty I couldn't even finish my second bite. I had to deconstruct my Rubin sandwich to eat it because the brisket was so fatty. The food took at least 30 minutes to get to us. I will never go back. My only advise it to stay away. There are so may worth while places to eat in Marietta don't waste your time or money.

data.title: Our lunch was PERFECT!
data.text: We had a wonderful lunch experience at the Vineyard while touring the local museums.  The food was over the top and we would recommend it to anyone!   The shop has pretty cute stuff too but the food was the highlight!   Our server was great.  The service is a little slow but makes for a very leisurely lunch.  I cant think of anything that would have made it better!

data.title: Birthday
data.text: I am an adult and do not ask for song and dance. It was lackluster at best. Not my best birthday lunch but not the worst  ever. I got a rock in a Reuben  on my 40th and the server asked how I enjoyed  my lunch. A local  and doubtful that I will venture to this spot again.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot
data.text: My husband and I dined here for lunch during Chalktoberfest and so we had a great view of the artists working down below on the street. The food was quite good and they have a wonderful selection of teas. I also just saw the other day that they are now serving wine and beer; that will be a great plus for this cozy restaurant.

owner_response.author: betty b, Owner at The Vineyard Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Glenda, I'm so very happy to hear that you and your husband enjoyed our cafe and we hope you come back and see us again.

I thought you might like to know that we are also starting a dinner theatre Friday and Saturday nights. Our first show is March 4th and we're really excited. We have four different plays lined up and our first season will run through June. We'll be posting details on both our Facebook page and website in the next few days so stay tuned!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Lunch!
data.text:
This little cafe is difficult to find. There's a small menu in the window, but no real directions to the cafe itself.  I'd been meaning to go here for ages, but felt a little awkward about barging into the gift shop, and asking "Where' the food?!" It just seems....brazen. So here's the deal. Go into the Vineyard gift shop on West Park, facing the Square.The one with the beautiful bay windows on the second floor.  You will see a large staircase. Simply go up the stairs, and the lady at the counter will see that you are seated. 

That's the hard part. Once found, this place is a gem.The building is old and atmospheric, with creaking wooden floors, and splendid views onto the Square from the giant bay windows.  They are only open for lunch, and serve mostly soups, salads, quiche and sandwiches. 

My friend got quiche and soup and said it was very good, particularly her soup. My turkey and bacon sandwich on cranberry walnut bread was fresh and delicious. The Greek pasta salad on the side was a little oily on the tongue, probably from being refrigerated,  but hey, what's Greek without a good dose of olive oil, and it was still good. The red velvet cake truffles were moist and rich, and being two of them, were easy to share. Everything was very, very fresh from the greens on the sandwich to the bacon and turkey. Did I mention fresh? Fresh, fresh, and more fresh, which was a delight. 

Service was very friendly, if a little spacey, but you can't fake friendly, which he certainly was, so he gets a pass. 

I can't believe I got a meal of this quality for under $9. If I could give extra stars for value, the Vineyard would rate them.  If the restaurant gods weren't so fickle, these guys would have a permanent waiting line. A little bit better signage would probably help. 

I'm kind of hoping I can talk her into making this a weekly thing. I would mind being Ladies Who Lunch, if I can luncheon at a place this good.

owner_response.author: betty b, Owner at The Vineyard Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Wow! Thanks for the great review. If you don't write reviews for a living you should. I hope you do make our little cafe one of your regular go to places for lunch. Ask for me next time you're in , would love to meet you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good selection, nice view of the square, great service and tasty
data.text: Enjoyed a nice lunch on a chilly afternoon by having soup and salad sitting in the upstairs dining room. Although we waited about 10 minutes for a table, it was worth it and the staff were welcoming and friendly. The peasant soup was just right, homemade broth, chicken, cabbage, and white beans. A cup was perfectly paired with half of a Tuscan salad with a good amount of meats, cheeses, and olives. I should have ordered some oil and vinegar dressing so be sure to mention your favorites as there are plenty of choices.

data.title: Poor service
data.text:
My sister and I decided to take our mother for a nice lunch today (Thursday).  We picked the Vineyard Cafe.  We arrived at around noon.  The waiter seemed a little rushed with us even though the place was not full.  We placed our drink order and he forgot the straws; I had to remind him to bring the straws10-15 minutes later....; then he took our order and we waited more than 30 minutes for a couple of simple sandwiches plus a cup of their soup.  The quality of the food was just ok; specially considering the fact that took over 30 minutes to make it.  We also noticed while we anxiously waited for our food that other guest that arrived later were served before us......don't really understand that.  Overall a bad experience from SERVICE to FOOD QUALITY.  We will not be back.
I strongly recommend you check other places before you waist your time at the Vineyard Cafe!

data.title: Great for a Girls Day
data.text:
One of my favorite things is the Chicken Salad Croissont.  Delicious...and the pasta salad is wonderful.

If you are looking for something fun and special to do, book a full tea party.  Great way to spend a Saturday afternoon with friends!

data.title: NEW OWNERS
data.text:
This is a great little restaurant with a great view. Food is still great. Prices are affordable.
Friendly folks. Eat upstair or on the ground floor outside. We will return. The Reuben  was O.K., BUT, if you want the best Reuben , Go to Shillings.

owner_response.author: betty b, Owner at The Vineyard Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Gerald,

Thanks for your review. Hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good but not a traditional Reuben
data.text: Went based on review "Best Reuben Ever" - while good it was not a traditional reuben as made with beef brisket not corned beef and with cole slaw instead of sauerkraut.  It was good but to me did not rate as the best reuben ever.  Service was good.

data.title: Outdoor cafe
data.text: My friend and I tried the outdoor seating on a beautiful day. The restaurant is upstairs and no one came to wait on us. The menu said to call the number and place your order which we did.  We had a Cobb salad and when the waitress brought it it was in a plastic to go  container with plastic forks. I looked like it came from  Publix.  I would not return. I have no idea about eating in the restaurant but outside dining is terrible.

data.title: Worth the Climb!
data.text:
This little gem hidden upstairs from a great little gift shop off the square was worth the stair climb to enjoy a delightful lunch with a tasty cup of tea in my own little press! Im-pressive!  The Harvest sandwich was wonderful on the Raisin whole grain bread but the "sweet"potato salad that accompanied my sandwich was a surprising culinary treat! Loved it!
All in all service was pleasant to go with the quaint atmosphere, and a view overlooking the Square. Will definitely be stopping in to sample more of their tasty menu soon! Great gift items downstairs too! Great for A Girls day out!
